It would be more of a challenge if we were forced to use the fonts for something. On a deserted island we wouldn’t need either. I suggest altering the challenge slightly:

You may only use one font in your designs for the rest of your life. Comic Sans or Papyrus? Go.

With Papyrus you will always find work in the spa identity field so if you want to put food on the table go with Pappy

Si
If you get a typeface you get a specimen of some sort and you can use it for fire.

Nothing personal, but I’d remove the zipper from my pants, use it and the thread to make a lure and line, catch a poisonous fish and eat it. (But only if I couldn’t convince you to eat it first).

Cheers!

\>Oh God not another one.

Here’s another five...

You’re in the basement of the Linotype office when a fire breaks out (don’t look at me). You can only rescue two sets of original drawings, what do you save?

You’re in a bar when a fight breaks out between Meta and Avenir. Which one do you clock with a half empty vodka bottle?

The US font foundries are about to go out of business (due to some font embedding scheme that went awry) – if you were the US government which one would you bail out?

You have a fox, a chicken, a row boat, a copy of InDesign CS 4, and a 1200dpi laser printer. How do get them all across the river?

A train leaves Chicago at 8am, and another leaves St Louis at 10am – which font gets to Los Angeles first.

1. Dwiggins drawings of Gill with his dog and Gill’s dog’s drawings of Dwiggins with Gill.  
2. While in Russia, it is illegal to discuss, or email a discussion pertaining to the wasting of vodka. Hide.  
3. If I were the US government you’d be the very first to know.  
4. Print 10 pictures of the chicken, rub them on the bird and feed them to the fox. When he’s full, load the boat and go.  
5. What font is it?

Cheers!

You and Si, way to salvage this thread.

Cheers!
